document.docAuthor: Liu, Tengteng, Wang, Shuxia & Li, Houhun
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Argyresthia Hübner, [1825] (Lepidoptera: Yponomeutoidea: Argyresthiidae) from China, with descriptions of forty-three new species

subSubSection.paragraph:
Tinea brockeella Hübner
, [1813]: pl. 53, fig. 262. TL: Europe. TD: The type of
brockeella
was lost ( Moriuti 1977 ).
Argyresthia brockeella (Hübner)
: Hübner, 1825: 422; Jin & Wang, 2012 : 235.
Tinea IW-ella
Haworth, 1828: 569.

Argyresthia brockella (Hübner)
: Stephens, 1835: 252. [misspelling]
Oecophora debrockeel Duponchel, 1838: 464
.

Argyresthia fulguralis Matsumura, 1931: 1096
. TL: Japan (Sapporo, Hokkaidô). TD: HUIC.
Argyresthia brockeella
ab. aurivitella Gibeaux, 1983: 130.
Description. Adult ( Figs. 55, 56 and 81 ) wingspan 10.5̄12.0 mm.
Male genitalia : As in Figs. 122 , 178 and 234 .
Variation ( Fig. 56 ): The forewing has the white dorsal fascia from before end of fold sharply narrowed or interrupted at anterior 2/5 from costa.

Host plants :
Betula
spp.,
Alnus glutinosa (Linn.) Gaertn.
( Betulaceae ) ( Agassiz 1996 ).

Distribution. China ( Beijing , Gansu , Hebei , Heilongjiang , Henan ,
Inner Mongolia
, Jilin , Liaoning , Ningxia , Qinghai , Shaanxi , Shanxi , Sichuan ,
Tianjin
, Yunnan , Xinjiang , Xizang ), Europe, Russia , Japan , Korea .

Diagnosis. This species is most similar to
A. ( A. ) goedartella (Linnaeus, 1758)
. In the male genitalia of
A. ( A. ) brockeella
the valva are widest in the distal 2/9, and the saccus is nearly uniform in width and rounded apically ( Fig. 122 ). In
A. ( A. ) goedartella
the valva is widest at the base, and the saccus is narrowed distally to a narrowly rounded apex ( Agassiz 1996: 79, Pl. 10, fig. 13 ). The variation in forewing pattern of
A . ( A .) brockeella
and
A. ( A. ) goedartella
are also similar, but the two species can be separated by the abovementioned genital features.

Remarks. The forewing color and patterns of both
A . ( A .) brockeella
and
A. ( A. ) goedartella
vary within populations; both pale and dark forms occur in both species ( Agassiz 1996 ). Variation in forewing pattern for
A . ( A .) brockeella
is newly described here.
